headline: Yogurt-Delivery Women Are More Than Food Couriers, They’re Family
text: SEOUL, South Korea — An hour before dawn, Kang Hye-jeong was already ​out cruising on her battery-run mobile refrigerator, briskly moving through alleys in Cheongdam-dong, a district of southern Seoul.
snippet: They were among the country’s first women to work outside the home, helping establish South Korea’s taste for dairy products. And these beloved “yakult ajummas” are still making their rounds.
